intro: Micranthes sachalinensis, commonly known as the Sakhalin micranthus, is a flowering plant native to the Russian Far East. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers and is often found in moist, rocky habitats. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
